1.content:
The sun rose to signal a start to the crisp summer morning in the dense forest. The beams of light soon found their way to the closed eyes of a little Riolu that was lying lazily on a tree branch. The sun rise caused the young pokemon's eyes to slowly open and eventually wake him.

The Riolu sluggishly got to his feet and let out a yawn, rubbing the last bit of sleep out of his eyes as he did so. This peaceful start was soon interrupted by a rather loud growl from Riolu's scrawny stomach.

"Guess it's time for breakfast..." he muttered to himself, rubbing his belly with his paws.

Riolu then swiftly made his way down from the tree and onto the forest ground. He'd only arrived in this forest a few weeks ago. Quite a few other pokemon lived in this forest as well, but Riolu had kept to himself, and since most of the others simply tended to their own business, everyone got along fine.

Another grumble from his belly made Riolu quicken his pace to where he was going.

He dashed around the trees until he came to the spot he was looking for: a small pond that was surrounded by enormous trees which had massive, bright-red apples hanging from them.

Riolu licked his lips as he gazed at the succulent fruit. He gathered all the strength he could and gave the tree a hard kick. Several apples fell to the ground around the tree. Not wanting to waste another moment, Riolu strained to picked up one of the huge apples with both paws.
But before he could take a bite, the earth beneath his feet began to shake.

"Oh no..." moaned Riolu. "Not HIM..."

The tremors became bigger and bigger as a giant Machoke came running to the pond, his footsteps shaking the ground as he ran.

This Machocke was a lot bigger than a normal one. Not just in height, but weight. His arms and legs were thick with fat and he had an enormous belly which hung out over his black belt.

"Morning, shrimpy!" he bellowed when he spotted Riolu with the apples. "Almost didn't see ya'. 'Cause you're so tiny! Har har har!"

"Just leave me alone...please," said Riolu, annoyed but trying to sound polite.

"What's that?" mocked Machoke. "I couldn't hear you...'Cause you're so tiny! Har har har!"

"(You already said that, moron,)" muttered Riolu, thankful that Machoke didn't hear him.

"I see you got me my breakfast," continued Machoke, slapping his stomach. "This gut needs some grub!"

He then grabbed the apple that Riolu was still holding onto and lifted it up with Riolu still holding on.

"Hey!" yelled Riolu. "This is mine! Go get your own!"

"Sorry, bug," said Machoke. "But this belly needs food to stay BIG and STRONG!"

He then flicked Riolu with his free hand right in his nose, causing Riolu to fall flat onto the ground. Machoke then proceeded to eat the entire apple in one bite, he then grabbed to others and gulped each one down, one by one. Once he'd eaten all the ones on the ground, he shook the tree with his meaty hands and all the apples in the tree hit the ground, which he then continued to eat.

Riolu tried to get his paws on another apple, but Machoke purposely grapped to ones Riolu tried to get or simply knocked Riolu away.
They continued to do this until Machocke had managed to eat all the apples in the area around the pound. When he finished, Machoke let out a massive belch and smacked his even bigger belly.

"Now that was some good eating!" Machoke said happily. "Too bad your not big enough to deserve food like me. I'd would've let you have some, but my belly needs it more than your puny one!"

The Machoke laughed to himself as he waddled away, the ground still shaking as he left. Riolu, however, stayed at the pond.

The rest of his body hurt too much for him to care about the empty feeling in his tummy. But what hurt even worse was what he saw staring back at him in the pond. Riolu's reflection showed a very small and violently treated pokemon who couldn't even have breakfast all because he was small.

The average Riolu weighs about 44 pounds, but this one was terribly malnourished, as it was very thin and probably only weighed 30 pounds.

He hardly stood a chance against that Machoke, which had to weight 255 pounds at LEAST. But there was hardly anything Riolu could do...

"Stupid, Machoke..." muttered Riolu angrily as his belly let out another loud growl. "I deserved those apples, but just because he's bigger than me he has to eat ALL of them! What about pokemon like me? Because of that jerk I haven't had a decent meal since I came to these woods..."

It didn't make sense why Machoke choose to pick on Riolu; the two had never met before Riolu came. Maybe it was because they were the only Fighting-types that lived here?

Before he could give it another thought, Riolu's stomach gurgled again.

"Oh..." he moaned, clutching his crying mid-section. "...so...hungry..."

Before he could pout any further...
1.title: A Bullied Riolu

choices: Three weeks after eating Miltank's cooking...
11.content:
Just then, a powerful scent reached Riolu's nose. A sweet, almost yummy smell. Whatever it was, he wanted it. While his belly still grumbled loudly, Riolu fallowed the scent through the forest grove.

As the scent grew stronger, Riolu could make out the smell. It was moist and sweet like apples, but these apples smelled different, like they were...warm?

"How could apples be...warm?" thought Riolu.

As he drew closer, he began to smell other things: honey...bread...and maybe even...milk.
The barrage of scents pleased Riolu's nose to no end, he HAD to have whatever they were coming from.

The scents finally lead Riolu to a small, red farm-house at the edge of the woods. The place looked abandoned but the sweet smells were definitely coming from here. And surely enough, five apple pies were neatly placed along a musty window sill to cool.
Riolu had never seen pie before; he didn't know apples could be prepared that way.

No longer ignoring the cries of his belly, Riolu snatched one of the pies without thinking and shoved the piping hot pastry into his mouth. He moaned with rapture as he chewed each warm, fruity bite passionately.
Before he knew it, the entire pie tin was licked clean.

"Mercy! You sure seemed hungry, eh pard'?" said a gentle, southern voice.

Riolu looked back up at the window to see who had spoken to him. Standing by the window with the other pies was a Miltank.

"That's the fastest I've ever seen anyone eat one of my pies," she said, a soft smile on her face.

"Oh!" gasped Riolu, realizing what he did. "I'm SO sorry! I didn't mean to...it's just that I was so..."

"Aw, shucks," Miltank interrupted. "It's alright. I could go without a pie or three. I make these for a living, see. Come on inside."

Riolu made his way through the front door and into the dank but still rather functional kitchen. He almost jumped when an egg timer started ringing.

"Oh?" said Miltank. "Done already?"

She waddled over to the outdated oven and pulled out a tray that smelled just as scrumptious as the pies.

"What are those?" asked Riolu intently.

"Honey biscuits," said Miltank. "Would like one?"

"Yes, please!" said Riolu, his face beaming.

"Careful, ya'll: they're still hot..." advised Miltank as Riolu took one off the tray.

It was more bland when compared to the fruity pie, but it was still warm and sweet.

"So delicious..." moaned Riolu before taking another bite.

"Here, take some more," said Miltank.

"Oh, I couldn't..." said Riolu, wanting to be polite.

"I insist," grinned Miltank. "Have some more pie as well if you like. I've also got plenty of milk too."

Riolu seated himself at the wooden table and MIltank placed the pies, biscuits, and a giant bottle of milk in front of him.

"Go ahead and dig in, I know you youngin's don't give much for table manners these days," she said. "Besides, you could use some meat on you."

Riolu was more than happy to let his stomach take control. He started with the biscuits, he polished of each one in about three bites each. He also grabbed a piece of pie every so often and cherished the fruity confection.

"I'm sorry the place is such a mess, pard'," said Miltank as she placed more pies into the oven. "It's been like this since I first came here. I've been meanin' to fix the place up, but an old gal like me just doesn't have the oomph." She popped her hip to emphasize her lack of youth.

"That's okay," Riolu said, swallowing another mouthful of biscuit. "I'm just grateful that you're letting me have this food."

"Oh, it's no trouble," said Miltank, stirring batter in a big bowl. "Like I said: I does this for a living. You look like you could use a good meal."

"Thanks loads," said Riolu.

When his throat became dry from all the bread, Riolu finally opened the milk jug. He placed his mouth on the end and slowly lifted it with both paws, causing the cold, creamy liquid to flow freely into Riolu's mouth.

He slowly chugged the yummy and nutritious milk, too distracted by the refreshing taste to notice the slowly expanding bulge in his belly.

The minutes ticked on into almost an hour and the biscuits and pies soon became cakes and souffles, and the bulge in Riolu's gut grew larger and larger, almost as big as a beach ball.

"Ya'll ready for another slice of cake?" asked Miltank cheerfully.

"Uhhh...*burp*..." muttered Riolu, rubbing his heavily bloated stomach. "(Oh...I feel like I'm going to explode...but maybe I'll have... just one more)."

Riolu took the final slice of chocolate cake off the platter, slowly took bite after bite of the wonderfully tasty dessert, and let out a small belch.

"No more...please..." he moaned. "I can't eat another bite...*urp*..."

"I should think so!" exclaimed Miltank. "Ya'll look almost as big as I am!"

"(Yeah...)" thought Riolu, getting a good look at his belly. "(I'm...bigger!)"

After thanking Miltank once again for everything, Riolu struggled to stand up from the chair and waddled carefully out of the house and back into the forest, his belly sloshing around as he did so.

"If I keep eating like that..." thought Riolu, patting his stuffed tummy. "...I'll be bigger in no time!"

111.content:
Riolu glanced up from the table, frowning. "Are you sure you're OK with me coming back here? I mean, I don't wanna mooch or anything..." he rubbed his stomach a bit, mouth watering slightly at the delicious aromas. In spite of his massive meal the day before, everything had digested almost back to its original state, owing partially to his Fighting type; though he had no way of knowing, they tended to have fast metabolisms (which made Machoke all the more unusual...)

Miltank merely chuckled, taking a large apple pie out of the oven and placing it in front of the young Pokemon. "I already told ya, young 'un: it's nice to have the company." She made her way over to him, ruffling the top of his head playfully. "Besides, it's not often I see a kid as well-mannered as you."

Riolu, blushing a bit at the affectionate gesture, nonetheless laughed and rubbed the back of his head. "Heh, thanks!" His stomach suddenly rumbled, reminding him why he'd come in the first place. Blushing a bit, he reached to take a handful of the pie...and quickly yelped and withdrew it, blowing on it frantically.

Miltank laughed. "Careful there, pardner; ya gotta let it cool a little."

It made sense, Riolu thought, but that didn't stop his brief look of disappointment. Nonetheless, Miltank caught it. "Oh, don't be like that." Smiling, she went over to the fridge and opened it, withdrawing a small tub of some kind. Shutting it, she made her way back over to the table and set the tub. "Here; why don't ya snack on this while ya wait?" She pried the lid off and slid it over to Riolu. Curious, the young Pokemon peered into it; it contained a thick, white substance of some sort.

Riolu tilted his head as he looked into the tub. "Huh? What's this?"

Miltank's eyes widened momentarily in an expression of surprise, but it was quickly replaced by a smile. "Oh yeah, fergot you lived in the forest." She gestured to the substance. "This here's ice cream; it comes in a lotta different flavors, but all of 'em are mighty tasty. This one's vanilla."

"Vanilla, huh?" Curiously, Riolu dipped his paw in scooping some of it out (and wincing as the cold treat contacted his slightly-burned paw), he lifted it to his face and took a few licks. As soon as he did so, his eyes widened, and his mouth dropped open a little bit.

Miltank smiled, placing an arm on her hip. "Well? Whaddaya think?"

The young Pokemon looked at her, a smile slowly growing across his muzzle. "This is really yummy!" Licking his lips, Riolu slurped what was left off his paw, only to dip it right back in and scoop an even bigger serving out. Now grinning, he stuck his whole paw in his mouth, only to withdraw it a second later sans the ice cream. He repeated this process a few times, but eventually decided he wasn't eating it fast enough. Getting an idea, he held the still nearly-full tub up to his face and stuck his muzzle in, slurping it down and kicking his feet slightly, greatly enjoying the sweet, cold dessert.

Watching him, Miltank chuckled. "Easy there, pardner; make sure ya leave some of that ice cream ta have with the pie."

At this, Riolu lowered the tub, his face ringed with white. "Huh? How come?"

Miltank gestured to the still-cooling pie. "I'll tell ya how come, kiddo; there ain't nothin' tastier than piping hot apple pie topped with just the right amount of vanilla ice cream." She winked at him. "Ain't sayin' ya can't keep doin' what you're doin', just don't eat it all 'fore the pie cools a bit."

Smiling, Riolu turned back towards the tub. "Thanks; I'll save some. Till then, though..." He lifted the ice cream back up to his face, continuing to slurp it down, albeit at a slightly more controlled rate.

On a wonderfully peaceful afternoon, Miltank was humming quietly to herself as she pulled a fresh batch of pies out of the oven.

Almost on cue, loud foot-steps could be heard approaching the small, run-down farm house.

"Right on time..." thought Miltank, getting the table set.

Before long, a big, round, blue belly knocked the front door open and Riolu squeezed his way into the house.

"Howdy," greeted Miltank. "Ready to eat?"

"You know it!" said Riolu happily, as he sat down on a wooden chair which creaked under his weight. "I'm starving!"

"Then go ahead and dig in!" said Miltank, gesturing to the sugary feast in front of Riolu. Which he was more than happy to start scarfing down.

Over the next few weeks, Riolu had visited Miltank every day, eating his fill of her scrumptious food every time.
Miltank would prepare endless amounts of pies, strudels, biscuits, and cakes all for Riolu to enjoy.

And all that excessive eating was really starting to show on Riolu. His once rail-thin body had plumped out in great size. His arms and thighs had grown very large and thick, his face had also become noticeably rounder and softer.
But nothing compared to his belly, which made him look like a big, blue ball with legs, arms, a head and a tail.

As he continued to visit, Riolu's appetite increased almost as quickly as his belly had. He would often eat a little more with each meal, he now ate about twice as much as he normally did, which only made him grow even faster.

Despite his change in weight, Riolu didn't have much trouble getting around. He could walk (er, waddle) like he normally could, but walking for a long time or just running would cause him to lose his breath. All that Milktank milk was certainly doing his body good, but he was still rather large for such a normally small pokemon.

Riolu even had to sleep on bigger tree branches to make sure they wouldn't snap under his new girth. (Which had happened more than once...)

After Riolu ate all he could and thanked Miltank, he decided to...

112111111.content:
Raichu awoke an hour or so before Riolu did, stretching as little as he could manage with his own fattened frame weighing him down and hindering his movements. He smiles as he gave his huge gut a pat, sending ripples through his blubber, thinking about and feeling grateful toward his friend Riolu, for helping to stuff him and fatten him up to this size.

He thought there was no better way to show gratitude for being fattened than to fatten up his fattener, craning his thick neck to get a better look at his companion. Taking note of how Riolu wasn't really that far behind him, quite the tubby puppy in fact. His legs and arms had plumped up nicely, but most of all that blue belly had grown, sticking out much further and wider than before they started their feast. But alas, try as he might, the Raichu could not stand up. Too fat, too rotund to even get good footing let alone stand up or even really roll. The only thing he succeeded in doing was making himself jiggle and work up a light sweat from the effort.

Just as soon as he had begun lamenting his inability to pay his friend back for the feeding, dark object with purple swirls fell from above and onto the Raichu's doughy chest, sinking in lightly into his fat. It was well within the reach of his own stubby limbs, and the swirls seemed to glow purple as he stared at it. After taking a closer look at it while holding it in his paws he discovered that it was, or at least looked like an apple. Even the outside seemed to smell abnormally delicious to him. "This would make a nice little present for Riolu, but it might not even be safe to eat. I've never seen an apple like this before. Oh well, nothing ventured, nothing gained" Raichu thought to himself, licking his lips as he began to feel drool welling up in his mouth, anxious to sample the hopefully delicious morsel before him.

He curiously brought it to his mouth, feeling it faintly pulse in his paws as he took a small bite and almost choked on how utterly... Delicious! It was. He couldn't find any other way to describe it, it was just a perfectly appley apple with a nice mixture of sweet and sour flavor, and plenty of juice. The juicy fruit and even the juice itself seemed to lightly buzz in his mouth, and then his throat and stomach once he swallowed the chunk he took.

That settled it, Riolu was having the rest of it, the Raichu decided. Looking forward to feeding his friend so much that he almost missed the effects of the unusual fruit he had consumed, his body adjusting and growing. Limbs growing to better touch the ground and reach for things. Bones thickening and muscles changing and growing (though still buried underneath all that flab) to support his otherwise immobile frame. His body growing taller and slightly less "fat", though no less round as warmth and energy seemed to course all around inside of him.

By the time it was over, the Raichu stood about slightly less than twice his previous height, and was actually able to stand. And move, quite well. Something he couldn't help but demonstrate to himself with a short hop that caused him to crash back onto the ground with a resounding, heavy thud. Leaving cracks in the ground around his feetpaws from the impact of his heavy frame falling back down to earth, regardless of how high he actually managed to "jump". Luckily, Riolu wasn't disturbed by the small quake, or even the resulting noises from all around as other pokemon reacted to the tremors.

With a big grin on his chubby face, Raichu went about gathering up more of the chocolate trees, and their fruit and even the marshmallow plants. Gathering small clusters of fruit from the trees and berries from the bushes and holding them against his plump chest with his now larger, thicker, stronger arms. Easily able to reach around most of his chest where before his "growth" he was too fat to do so. And once the fruits were all gone from the chocolate trees he had chosen and gathered into a neat little pile near his sleeping ball of a friend, he proceeded to barge into the bare trees with his bare belly. Even with the great big ball of his gut being soft and doughy from all that blubber, with his weight and newfound strength behind his charges the trees didn't stand much of a chance, either snapping right away or bending until eventually the Raichu's tummy won out and brought the more resistant ones down.

The pile of food slowly grew and grew until the Raichu had brought back enough chocolate filled fruit, marshmallows, and chocolate trees broken into smaller pieces for easier management, that each pile stood about as tall and as wide as he was. He gave a prideful snort and puffed his already puffy chest out, feeling quite content with the feast he brought for his friend.

Raichu sat down next to his heavy sleeper of a friend, cracking the ground and sending another tremor through the area as he plopped himself down, reached down toward Riolu's belly, and shook it, sending wobbles through the aura puppy's padded frame. Surprisingly, being touched made his friend wake up quite quickly. The Riolu sitting up as much as he could manage and rubbing at his eyes, letting out a yawn and letting his gaze fall upon his friend, having yet to notice the pile of food nearby.

"Mmmnnh... Good morning Raichu."
"Morning Riolu, Sleep well?"
"After everything we ate? You bet, I think it must've been what they call a food coma. We ate soooo much!"
"Oh, well hope you're still not stuffed. You hungry?"
"Actually. Yeah."
"Oh good."

The Raichu smirked as he pointed off to the side toward the pile of food he'd gathered, watching with a smile as the Riolu's expression changed from confusion, to curiosity as he turned his head, and then jaw-opening surprise at the several Raichu-sized mounds of food nearby, with a black apple sitting at the very top of a pile of chocolate apples.

"When did all that get there!?"
"While you were sleeping. C'mon, get up and go over to it. It's your turn to be fed now, Riolu. I'll feed you until you're even bigger than I am."

With a grunt from competing with his recent weight gain while standing up beside Raichu, Riolu was surprised again to find that Raichu stood at least twice his previous height and was now... Mobile.
"Odd" Said Riolu. "How did you get so big so fast? And I don't mean fat. I mean... You're taller now, and your arms and legs are bigger."
"Oh yeah. That. It was because of that weird black and purple apple in the pile. I tried it out to see if it was safe to give to you because I felt bad that you got to feed me so much and I ended up immobile before I had the chance to return the favor. And for some reason, well, it made me grow."
"I wonder if it'd work on me..." Riolu smiled, his chubby tail wagging uncontrollably from side to side as he turned to and squeezed Raichu's squishy wall of belly in a big hug, feeling the Raichu's arms wrap around him and pull him closer into that soft tummy.
"Maybe. I can't see why it wouldn't. I think you should save it until after you've fattened up some more, and even then, only eat a single bite. Don't worry, I'll put it in your mouth if you can't move."
"Huh? Why should I only have a bite?"
"Well, it's just a hunch, but. Just a little bite took quite a bit of my fat and made me taller and stuff. I dunno what'll happen if it "takes" more than you have, if you know what I mean."
"Oh. Come to think about it, you look less plump than you should've been if you just grew."

Releasing Riolu from his paunch, the Raichu began to walk with his friend toward the pile of food, being mindful not to move too much so that his bulk didn't swing into and knock his friend over.

After he had finished eating all of that food, he was no longer a small Riolu. Now he was as fat as a Snorlax. 12.content:
"...Hey..." whispered a voice.

Riolu almost jumped when he heard it.

"Hello?" answered Riolu quietly. "Who's there?"

"...Over here..." the voice said. "...behind the bushes..."

Riolu followed the source of the voice throughout the shrubs in front of him and found himself at the entrance to a cave. He nearly fell over when a Banette appeared out of no where.

"...Hello..." greeted the ghost pokemon in the same, whispery voice.

"Hi..." Riolu said meekly. "Who are you?"

"I'm Banette..." said Banette as he bowed slightly. "...and I believe I may have the solution to your problem...Come inside, and I'll explain..."

Riolu followed Banette into the cave. Upon entering, Riolu noticed several small bottles with all kinds of strange objects scattered across the cave, ornate bookshelves with hundreds of old books stacked along the walls, and a cauldron filled with a glowing and bubbling green substance.

"...You see..." began Banette. "...I dabble in...Hmm...'unique' studies...I use this knowledge to help pokemon in need...such as yourself..."

"I...uh...still don't understand..." said Riolu. "What do you want from me?"

"Ohhh...I already have what I want from you..." said Banette, inhaling deeply. "...Your...hatred...your...anger and....your hunger..."

Riolu's stomach gurgled loudly again on that last part.

"I can use the power from these...emotions...to..." continued Banette slowly. "...grant you...a wish."

"A wish?" exclaimed Riolu. "As in: anything I want?"

"Speak your deepest desire to me..." said Banette. "...and I shall make it real!"

Riolu's first thought was to get something to eat. But a big smile spread across his face as he thought of what he really wanted: to be bigger than Machocke! If he was bigger than Machoke, he'd never have to worry about food ever again!

"I wish for something that will make me bigger!" said Riolu eagerly. "I want to be bigger than Machoke!"

"Very well..." said Banette. "...I believe I have just the thing...for you..."

Banette floated around the cauldron in a rhythmic pattern. Muttering what sounded like gibberish to Riolu and occasionally tossing in something off a shelf.
The potion in the pot slowly thickened and stopped glowing, the result being a disgusting black sludge that continued to bubble slowly.

Banette reached his arms into the cauldron and eventually pulled something out of the goop. It appeared to be a black apple with several purple swirl patterns on it.

"What is that?" asked Riolu, a bit afraid of the peculiar object.

"This...er...'apple'...." explained Banette. "...shall grant you that which you desire..."

"So if I eat this...I'll grow big?" said Riolu.

"It'll do the trick...yessss..." wheezed Banette, handing the 'apple' to Riolu.

"Gee, thanks!" said Riolu. Without another word, Riolu dashed out of the cave with the 'apple'.

"I best get...going..." muttered Banette to himself. Both he and his possessions slowly started to fade away. "...don't want to get caught up in...this one...hmm hmm hmmmm!"

Once he left the cave, Riolu looked at the strange fruit he'd received. It certainly looked good enough to eat. But should he eat it now, or eat it right in front of Machoke?
12.title: A friend from the other side...

choices: He wakes up and continues eating.
He wakes up, but he's smaller.
121.content:
Since he hadn't had a single thing to eat all day, Riolu decided to eat the whole thing right then and there.

He ravenously ate the odd fruit as though it were a regular apple. Taking big, merciless bites, he polished off the dry, semi-sweet 'apple' within a matter of seconds. He even managed to swallow the core, thus leaving no remains of it.

"Huh?" thought Riolu. "I don't feel any bigger..."

But before Riolu could think about it any further, a sharp pain grew in his stomach. He yelped in pain and clutched his aching belly as it growled loudly. Riolu felt like he hadn't eaten in months, his stomach need something in it NOW!

Without even thinking, Riolu plucked handfuls of grass from the ground and shoved them into his mouth, swallowing them instantly.

"Need...*gulp*...food!" Riolu moaned, still trying to make a meal out of the grass.

He stopped eating for a moment, looking rather absent-mindedly at a nearby tree. His eyes began to glow an unnatural shade of pink as he stared at the natural beauty. In the zombie-like trance he was in, he walked to the tree...and took a massive bite out of it!

The entire section of bark, in Riolu's mouth, then gone in one big gulp! He continued to chomp away at the tower of wood, swallowing each bite without chewing. When the tree's base no longer had ample support, the whole thing came crashing down with a loud THUD! But Riolu didn't stop, with the same pink glow in his eyes, he continued to eat the fallen tree.

Bite after bite, gulp after gulp, Riolu's belly grew at an alarming rate to accommodate the amount of 'food' Riolu was inhaling.

After a few minutes, all that was left of the tree was its chipped stump and some scatted leaves. Everything else was stuffed into Riolu's ENORMOUS belly, which towered over the forest grove. The weight of his gut caused him to fall back onto his rump.

"So I guess that's what the apple does..." thought Riolu to himself, snapping out of the trance for a minute. "...I can now eat ANYTHING I want to!"

He rubbed his belly as much as he could with his puny paws, cherishing how big he really was. But that tree was hardly enough for him; he still felt famished!

Riolu then spotted a boulder that was a bit smaller than his stomach.

"What are you looking at?!" mocked Riolu to the boulder. "You're not that big!"

With the pink glow returning to his eye, Riolu bent over the boulder and with unnatural strength, lifted it up to his mouth and SWALLOWED it whole! Riolu nearly doubled in size, not just his belly this time, but his whole body.
He then lifted himself back up with the help of his bigger and stronger legs and waddled over to another tree, shaking the ground as he did so.

He then started to eat the other tree even quicker than the first (thanks to his bigger mouth and stronger arms).
Riolu continued to swallow entire mouthfuls of tree, reducing the once magnificent symbols of nature into worthless pieces of splintered wood.

Riolu also grew even bigger with each tree he ate. His legs, arms, and head grew a bit more into equal proportion of his monstrous stomach, but his belly was still quite large and round. But he had now gotten big enough to up-root an entire tree with just his paws, and then chomp away down the trunk.

After awhile, eating all that wood made Riolu pretty thirsty. Luckily, he had returned to the area with the apples trees and the pond by then.

Rolling onto his huge belly, Riolu lowered his head down to the expansive body of water and began to drink the pond water. It didn't take long, due to his new found size. In a matter of minutes the pond was reduced to a hole in the ground with a few Magikarp flopping away for their lives.

Having eaten his fill for now, Riolu rolled onto his back, filling in the hole that once held so much water. Water that was now gurgling in Riolu's colossal stomach.

"What in the...?!" said a loud voice.

Riolu rolled over onto his tummy to look at the source of the voice. Only to find that Machoke, that one pokemon that had mocked Riolu for his puny size, was gaping at the big, blue pokemon that had just drank the massive pond dry. Machocke was just barely bigger than Riolu's head.

"How in the HECK did ya' get so big?" asked Machoke, still in unbelievable shock and quaking with fear.

"Sorry..." said Riolu in a booming but still quite childish voice. "...I almost didn't see you. Cause you're so tiny!"

Without warning, Riolu picked up Machoke with a giant paw, and straighted his body upright so that Machoke could see just how big he'd gotten. This didn't calm Machoke in the slightest.

"Hey! Put me down ya' freak!" yelled Machoke. Struggling hopelessly against Riolu's grip.

"Sorry, bug," said Riolu, the pink glow returning to his eyes. "But this belly needs food to stay BIG and STRONG!"

Once again under the influence of the apple, Riolu opened his maw, dangled the tiny pokemon over his tounge (which pathetically protested) and dropped him. In one gulp, the once arrogant and selfish Machoke was no more.

Riolu let out a short burp, and then rolled onto his back again to resume his comfortable position. Yawning slightly, he closed his eyes and drifted into a very relaxing sleep.

Later...
121.title: Riolu eats the apple...THEN EVERYTHING ELSE!

choices: During the feeding Riolu evolves and begins to fart
1211.content:
Riolu yawned and opened his eyes. It was now nighttime. His little nap lasted longer than expected. Riolu shrugged and began to turn onto his mountain he called a belly but to no avail.

"Huh? What the-"
Riolu was tied in place with floating water that seemingly had no gravity but was still strong enough to keep the glutton in place.

"SILENCE!" A loud booming voice yelled, Riolu looked around and saw a massive shadow, at least 3 times the size of him. Riolu panicked and began to try and break free. "No! No! Please don't eat me!"

The shadow drew nearer and Riolu felt really silly, a vast swarm of tribal-looking Slowpoke appeared out of the shadows. Unlike other Slowpoke, these Slowpoke looked angry and dare he say it, smart.

A chubby Slowking stepped forward, nowhere near as big as Riolu.

"W-who are you?"

"I am Cheif Ekopwols of the Psywave tribe. But you can just call me Cheif. You drained our lake, you shall now be punished!" The Slowpoke and Slowbro surrounding Riolu took aim with bows and arrows made out of shells and swords made out of clams.

Now was the time to panic, if any of them shot Riolu he would surely pop, or worse, fart. With quick thinking for the clever fighting-type he is, Riolu made up a lie. A great lie the Slowpoke couldn't turn away.

"HOW DARE YOU TREAT YOUR GOD LIKE THISSS?!" Riolu bellowed, louder than the Slowking.

All of the Slowpoke looked pale, they quickly sheathed their weapons and immediately bowed, Slowpoke and Slowbros broke out in thousands of cries and shouts. Riolu smirked. The only one who didn't bow was the Cheif. He stood there shell shocked.

"I-I'm so sorry my liege..." Cheif muttered, "Whatever can we do to repay you, we're sure the drinking of our lake was a great reward from you, we solemnly apologize. Now, please don't eat us!"

Riolu sneered, "It is too late for that! I will devour every single one of you!" The Slowpoke cried in protest, "Unless...you do something for me..."

"Yes, anything you desire my lord!" Cheif panicked.

""First, I want you to release me of this watery prison!" Riolu bellowed,

The Slowking went pale, "I'm afraid I cannot do that..."

"And why not?!" Shouted Riolu, a bit panicked.

"Those cuffs are made to trap our worst enemies until it strangles them, so I-uh-we can eat them. That is how I-erm-we hunt my obeseness." Cheif took a few steps back. "You see, I've always wanted to be the largest Pokémon in the world, so I could appease our God, and here you are. They say you give blessings to become large like you. I crave your fat."

Just then, Riolu got an idea to break the chains.

"But of course! Here, lie down next to me underneath the chains, we shall both feast and break these sacred bonds. We both get what we desire, you become humongous, and I become humongouser and free!"

The Slowking did as he was told and lay down next to Riolu, clearly excited to become a blob.

"But beware, becoming a blob like me has great conveniences and great consequences. Once you start growing, you will never stop. Now, order your minions to bring us food, I'm starved."

Cheif nodded and shook with excitement, Riolu turned his massive head to look at the Slowpoke go and retrieve food for him. Due to his head movement, a piece of the apple fell from his jowels and landed in the Slowking's mouth. He willingly ate the apple, rubbed his tummy, then his eyes went pink as he smirked maliciously.
1211.title: A Rude Awakening

choices: On his way, something distracts him
1212.content:
Riolu fluttered his eyes open and gav out a cute yawn. He stretched his arms over his head and laid them back onto the gigantic mass that was his belly, loving the feeling of his paws sinking into the waves if fat. ‘Yesterday was amazing…” Riolu cooed, relishing in the comfort his body was giving him as he laid in the remains of the lake. “I’m so big now...and hey! I’m not hungry anymore!”

It was true, the once little Pokemon’s stomach no longer cried out for more food. Not to say that he was full, in fact his stomach was completely empty from digesting it’s massive feast earlier. Yet despite that it did not growl or gurgle, content and placated like a tamed pet. Riolu gave a sigh and muzzled his fluffy moobs, taking immense pleasure in playing with his new flabby body.

Although, all things had to come to an end, as Riolu heaved himself up with ease and stood in the middle of the former lake. To his surprise, it turns out that while he slept, he must have shrunk! He was still huge, but his whole body did not plug up the lake like it used to. But he wasn't particularly worried about that. Riolu still towered over the forest with his enormity, and he never had to worry about bigger Pokemon bullying him, because he was the biggest!

Smiling with a newfound appreciation of life, Riolu began to march wherever his feet led him, trampling the Forest underneath his fat paws.

“Wow...everyone looks so tiny from up here!” Riolu exclaimed as he looked down at all the Pokemon running away from him, not wanting to get stomped on like the others. They all clabbered to get the farthest away from Riolu’s fat soles as they slammed into the Earth playfully, leaving huge pawprints inn their wake. “Hello down there!” He said cheerfully, not understanding that they were afraid of him.

Suddenly, a strange scent came to the giant Pokemon’s nose. Riolu closed his eyes and sniffed the air inquisitively, trying to find the source of the smell. It was sweet and sugary and reminded him of the human food that they had in the cities. Riolu opened his eyes once he was in direction of the scent, and gasped in delight.

In the distance, there was the outline of another one of those Human cities, probably chock full of delicious treats and goodies for him to eat. “I said I wasn't hungry anymore.” Riolu’s eyes flashed pink for a moment. “I never said i wasn't full!”

With that, he got down on all fours, his belly colliding violently with the rest of the forest, and began to sprint towards the city, tongue hanging out as he imagined all the food that was waiting for him.
1212.title: He wakes up, but he's smaller.

choices: Suddenly, the Trainer got an Ingenious plan!
Suddenly, a Legendary Pokemon tries to stop him!
12121.content:
Pretty soon, Riolu came to a skidding halt on the outskirts of the city, kicking up huge plumes of dust and unearthing several trees in his wake. He looked down on the city with big, curious eyes. “Teehee! You all look like bugs!” He said childishly as he picked a nearby building. It was a Human house, with the owners in question trying to get out before it they were too high up.

Riolu brought the house up to his nose and took a big whiff of the structure. To his amazement it smelled like...baked goods! Of course it was not, it was made of wood and metal, but to Riolu it was like he was in food heaven. With a happy smile he tossed the house into his open maw and swallowed it without chewing.

Grinning, Riolu got back down on his big, fat belly, causing the Earth around him to shake under his weight. He than began to lazily shovel in parts of the city into his eager mouth, loving how the his tastebuds were assisted with all kinds of pleasant flavors.

The populace of the city tried to escape the wrath of the hungry Pokemon, but as he plucked more and more buildings from their foundations, more and more humans were getting eaten as well. He barely chewed with his eyes half closed, in a ultra relaxed trance as he ate and ate and ate…

Al the while, Riolu’s belly eagerly converted the ‘food’ into more plush blubber. Hundreds of pounds formed on his frame, expanding outwards and upwards with every passing minute. His posterior became bigger than two wailord stir each cherk, the two jiggling orbs tossing over the rest of his body as he laid on top of his belly.

And what a belly it was! As Riolu went on from the suburbs to the City’s financial district, his growth skyrocketed. His hyper soft belly oozed onto the earth, smushing anything and anyone that was too close to it. “Mmm...so good…” Riolu murred as he began to chow down on ice the cities last remaining skyscrapers.

It wasn't long until an entire army of Pokémon Trainers had arrived to help the remaining inhabitants of the city. All at once, they got their strongest Pokémon to fire their most effective moves at the Giant Pokemon in unison. The collaborative attack simply bounced off Riolu’s quivering blubber.

“Gah! Nothings working!” The trainer in charge said as Riolu move onto the industrial district. “What can we do?! It’s going to eat everything!”

Meanwhile, Riolu continued his feast with vigor. Steel factories and textile mills fell into his gut and became fat in his thighs as he glutted.
12121.title: Soon, he made it.

121212.content:
As he glutted the remains of steel and textile into his ever-expanding gullet, one Legendary Pokemon was made aware of this. A Jirachi. As she arrived on the scene and surveyed the damage, she floated in front of the Riolu who was in the middle of eating another factory and blasted him with a powerful Psychic, knocking him on his back and making it harder for him to get up.

"Stop this assault on this city! The people!" Jirachi shouted.

But Riolu smiled as he got back up, licking his lips. "I haven't eaten any bugs Jirachi, they are too cute for that. But you're not a bug." He then charges towards the Jirachi, leaving giant prints in the ground and covers her in his giant paws. Jirachi tried to break free, but his paws were so fat and hot that it was difficult for her to charge up an attack or plan.

Excited that he had captured Jirachi for the time being, Riolu began doing a little dance, causing massive quakes and leaving giant dents in the ground. As this was going on, Jirachi continued to feel the heat wash over her as well as her oxygen beginning to wane.

Eventually, Riolu was no longer satisfied with Jirachi and decided to nom her as well. But as he opened his mouth, Jirachi was freed and stopped her descent with her energy.

"Stop, don't eat me."

"Why?" Riolu replied.

"Because who else will keep you company. Think about it, you've already gotten really big, so who would stop/help you from consuming the planet if you ate me?"

Riolu pondered this for a moment before coming to his conclusion. "All right, I'll let you live. As long as you help me."

Jirachi breathed a sigh of relief. "Of course Riolu."

Riolu smiled. "Yay. Now then, it's time to finish this city."

And so, with no opposition, Riolu continued his rampage across the city. Scooping up buildings in one hand and dirt/gravel in the other and shoving it down his throat at once. With one final cannonball, the city was destroyed and Riolu was very happy. He had not only devoured an entire city, but he had a wish-granting Legendary at his finger tips.

While Riolu was making a dirt-angel in the debris with a big grin on his face, Jirachi appeared in front of his big flabby face with a question.

"As a thank you for sparing my life, you are entitled to as many wishes as you want. So, what is your first wish?" Jirachi asked.
121212.title: Suddenly, a Legendary Pokemon tries to stop him!

1212121.content:
With the big grin plastered onto his flabby face never leaving, Riolu closed his eyes and thought hard on what he wanted to wish for from Jirachi. Without thinking, he lifted both of his hand paws up from the ruins of the city beneath him and plunged them into his great, big sphere of fluffy fat that was his belly. He let out a soft murr as his fat paws rubbed his blubbery belly, feeling as content as can be.The childish Pokémon truly loved in how fat he was. It felt amazing to be so big and powerful, always warm and soft. The plush padding around his body ensured that he was comfortable at all times, flesh bouncing and jiggling with every movement. The only thing Riolu’s mind seemed to gravitate towards was more food to eat so he can get even bigger. To his credit, he did attempt to think of other things. He tried thinking of wishing to see Banette again so he can give a big hug as thanks. He tried thinking of wishing to resurrect Machamp so the two of them could ply. But try as he might, the urge to eat and grow was just too powerful, not that he minded terribly.

Riolu opened his eyes and sniffed the air delicately. There was another delicious scent wafting through the wind, so good a thin line of pristine, clear drool rn down his plush, blue fur. He turned his head lazily to the origin of the scent, and saw the same forest where he had came from. His already large smile got just a little bit bigger as he licked his lips, not seeing his former home and testament to nature’s might, but another all you can eat buffet. But he was so relaxed spareld out on the ground, and the woodland was so far away...

Suddenly, Riolu came up with the perfect wish to solve his problem. “Hey,” the overgrown puppy turned it’s head back to Jirachi, an eager and curious look in his eyes. “Um...what’s the name of that thing you did earlier, when you hit me without using your hands?”

Jirachi tilted it’s head in confusion, not understanding the question completely. “You...you mean my psychic?”

“Yeah, that’s it!” Riolu suddenly grabbed the small legendary out of the air as he sat up. “I want one of those! I wanna be a psychic like you!”

Jirachi grimaced, knowing fully well that such a hunger mixer with psychic abilities would have devastating results. Nevertheless, she promised the baby Pokemon he was entitled to as many wishes as he liked, so she had no choice but to grant it. “...very well.” She sighed, closing her eyes before she began muttering some ancient enchantments. Soon, a bright flash erupted from her body, blinding Riolu a bit.

“They're, your now a psychic type.” Jirachi grunted, feeling the heat from Riolu’s pudgy paws warn her body up to uncomfortable levels. “So...what now?”

“Hmm…” Riolu hummed, rubbing his neck in contemplation. As he fiddled around with his neck rolls, an idea popped into his head. “Oh, that’s perfect!”

“What is?” Jirachi asked, not liking how the baby Pokemon was able to dominate her so casually. Unfortunately, she was about to get her answer as Riolu lifted up her small body to his neck, and with a gasp she was plunged in between his cheek and neck roll, smushing her body without mercy.

“Hehe, That tickles!” Riolu giggled as Jirachi tried to wiggle herself free. With his personal wish granted stowed away, the puppy Pokémon tried to test his newfound psychic powers. He looked around and saw a small house that he must have overlooked during his rampage. He lifted up one of his paws and focused on it, and before long an aura outlined the structure that lifted it up from it’s foundations. With a delighted squeal, he brought the small structure to his mouth and swallowed.

With a happy sigh, Riolu leaned back into the smushed earth and closed his eyes. He lazily wagged one of his fat fingers, and focused on the great woodland he once called home. One by one, the trees and foliage of the forest began to uproot themselves and hover they're way to Riolu’s slightly ajar mouth.
1212121.title: Psychic Type Riolu

12121213.content:
What sort of wish does Riolu make?

1. He feels a little bit alone, now that he's too big to play with anyone. So, he wishes that Jirachi was just like him so that they could be friends!

2. He starts to get bored of just eating, so to liven himself up, he wishes that someone would try to stop him.

3. He wishes Machoke back to life to tease him again with his weight. He hasn't forgotten who made him want to get big in the first place~
12121213.title: Riolu makes another wish

choices: Riolu let's Jirachi eat the rest of the Forest
Riolu goes on with his own feast
Riolu and Jirachi keep bonding together
121212131.content:
As Riolu continued with the psychic propelled feast of his former forest home, he began to feel a deep hunger that wasn't emanating from his rapidly ballooning stomach but in fact his heart. Curious and, for reasons he did not yet know, sad, he momentarily halted his massive binge to inspect himself, leaving his powerful belly to catch its metaphorical breath. The baby jackal Pokemon was confused with why a frown was creeping up on his pudgy visage, for he had everything he needed.

Riolu’s warm and comfortable blubber would make sure he would never go cold again. His stomach, while impossible to truly fill, had sedated his hunger. No Pokemon or human could ever hope to bully him ever again due to his massive size and newfound strength, as well for him having eaten their homes. So why was he feeling so depressed? At this time, Jirachi, having grown hot and bothered smooshed up inside her new master’s neck rolls, wiggled out and flew out in front of his face with an irritated expression.

“Hey!” The legendary wish maker shouted, getting Riolu’s attention. “Just because I grant you wishes now, doesn't mean you can go and treat me however you want!” At first, he was annoyed that his new toy was talking back to him like that, but as he stared at her, he realized the cause of his sudden sorrow. He was lonely. He was used to the solitude before, living in isolation with the forest, but he wanted more now. He wanted a friend that he could track to when he was down, somebody that could cheer him up with their presence.

However, as Riolu stared at Jirachi, an idea to remedy this began to form in his head. “I’m...I’m sorry, Jirachi.” He apologized with genuine feeling, catching the little legendary by surprise. “I got carried away, I guess. I just wanted to get bigger so much!... I forgot that I can hurt people when I’m big, though.”

Jirachi expected the baby Pokemon to act like...his age, essentially. She had no idea how Riolu got so powerful in the first place, but she knew that, like all kids, he would bratty, selfish, and throw a tantrum when things don’t go their way. So, hearing that he was actually sorry for his actions towards her made her feel more sympathetic towards her new captor. He was a kid, and didn’t know what he had been doing is bad.

“Well...thank you. Just don’t do it again!” Jirachi scolded, to which Riolu let out a pained whimper that almost melted her heart. “Um...hey, why don’t you make another wish? That’ll cheer you up!” She tried to lift the spirits of the overgrown Pokémon, knowing in the back of her mind it may very well cause more destruction and chaos.

“It’s...it’s really fun to be like this,” Riolu explained, patting his soft tummy gently. “I’m big, and warn, and soft, and strong! But...it stops being fun when there isn't anyone to do it with.” Suddenly, he grabbed Jirachi out of the air as gently as he could, careful to not crush her this time. She was surprised but was comforted that he was trying to rein in his strength for her.

“Jirachi…” Riolu made his wish known with a small blush on his bulbous cheeks. “I wish you were just like me so that we could be best friends and get bigger together.” Jirachi was taken aback slightly. She had made many a greedy wish true by selfish mortals, but she would never have expected one if the rare, good-natured ones to come from the monstrous Pokémon that demolished an entire city. He looked on to her form with expecting eyes, waiting for a response.

Jirachi blushed back and gave Riolu a small smile. “Your wish is granted.” With that, she closed her eyes once again and began to channel forth some long-dead language that Riolu didn’t understand. She thought that by granting this wish, she would be able to curtail his destructive tendencies, assuming that she herself would not give way to gluttony. But the nature of the wish was for her to become just like him, and before she could realize what that meant, the deed was done.

Jirachi’s body began to glow pure white, blinding Riolu’s eyes and forcing him to close them shut until the light disappeared. When it went away and he opened his eyes to the world again, what was sitting in his pudgy palms was not the legendary Pokémon he knew, but a little Riolu just like him. “H-huh?” He blinked at this new Pokemon, who just smiled and waved back at him in response. “Who are you?”

“Silly, it’s me, Jirachi!” The other Riolu giggled with a feminine voice as she wiggled her way out of the main Riolu’s grasp and flew up to his face to hug his fat cheek. “Or, at least I was. But now I’m a Riolu, just like you wished for!”

“Haha! H-hey, stop that, it tickles!” Riolu laughed with his sense of loneliness disappearing rapidly, Jirachi now filling the dark space in his heart. “Hmm...but you’re not quite like me yet. You’re still so tiny!” He playfully smooshed the legendary turned jackal with his cheek into his shoulder flab, prompting a cute giggle from her.

“Maybe right now I am, but not for long!” Jirachi grinned at her new best friend. Her whole personality had changed to Riolu’s, it was almost as if there wasn't a speck of the original left save for her being a girl and still having the power to grant wishes. She flew down from his face and took a perch on his mountainous stomach, snuggling and nuzzling the plush sphere of fur and fat before laying back on it in comfort. Like he had done earlier, the first once again began to diminish as she took her fair share, trees and bushed ripping up from the ground and into her mouth.

"Woah...is that how I look like when I'm eating?" Riolu awed at the sight of Jirachi rapidly ballooning outwards with soft blubber across his stomach. "I must be cute as a button because you sure are!" Jirachi blushed and gave the bigger Riolu a happy wink, signaling she appreciated the compliment. She would have just said so, but her mouth was too preoccupied at that point.
121212131.title: 1. A Tale of Two Riolus

12122.content:
With each passing second, the city within Riolu's line of sight grew closer. Just a little more, and he was sure to have a feast fit for a growing giant such as himself. He can picture it now: countless exotic delicacies gracing his tongue, and later his soon-to-be-growing belly with their presence. Riolu could barely hold in his excitement! Not even that brownish thing hurtling towards his face will-wait, WHAT?!

Oww, was all Riolu could think. In one blow, he was sent tumbling to the ground, dazed and unaware of what just happened. "Hurry, pin him down before he recovers!" By the time Riolu was able to fully process that command, it was already too late. One by one, his wrists and ankles began to stick to the ground, as if someone was holding them down. Looking around, Riolu quickly realized no one was grabbing hold of him; this was the work of a Psychic-type pokemon. But who in the world would have that kind of power, given the Fighting-type's size? It was then that he saw it: right by his head, there were 5 pokemon staring up at him. But they were no ordinary pokemon. No, these pokemon were from stories Riolu's mother told him when he was very young. These pokemon were the stuff of legends. These pokemon were practically gods. They were none other than the Swords of Justice, accompanied by Celebi, who, assuming the glowing blue eyes and outstretched hands were any indication, is the one responsible for holding him down like this. "Whoa......" the smallest Sword of Justice, Keldeo, remarked. "I've never seen a Riolu this big before! I had no idea they came in this size!"

"They don't," replied Cobalion, the group's leader. "This is far from natural, the size of this Riolu. This almost looks like......" Virizion, who is said to be the most graceful Sword of Justice, finished the sentence. ".....Black magic."

"Now hold on," bellowed Terrakion, who, in retrospect, was most likely the thing that hit Riolu just a moment ago. "Didn't we snuff out that practice centuries ago? We even had Heatran burn up all those books they used." Cobalion nodded slowly, lost in thought. "We did, we did............or did we?" Bemused looks surrounded him. Before long, he spoke again. "Riolu, I want you to tell us how you came to be this size. And be honest."
12122.title: Suddenly, he was stopped!

122.content:
Riolu thought it would be best to eat the apple right in front of Machoke, and maybe then he'll show that jerk a thing or two.

Without haste, Riolu dashed throughout the forest to look for the monstrously overweight pokemon, carefully clutching the weird apple in both paws as he did so.

Soon, Riolu began to feel heavy footsteps coming from off in the distance. Which he then promptly followed deeper into the forest. After awhile of chasing the loud quakes, Riolu finally found the obese Machoke waddling through the forest grove.

"Hey, you!" yelled Riolu.

"Huh? Who said that?" mocked Machoke when he heard Riolu's voice.

"Hey, fatty!" Riolu yelled, trying to get the self-centered pokemon's attention.

"What? Ohhh, hey, shrimpy!" said Machoke. "Almost didn't see you, cause you know: you're so..."

"Tiny," interrupted Riolu. "I know. That's only the 100th time you've said it! It's not that funny."

"Maybe not," said Machoke. "But it's still true! Anyways, whatcha got there, flea?"

"Oh, this?" said Riolu, holding out the apple proudly. "Just a little something I found..."

"Too bad I just ate..." said Machoke, slapping his large gut. "Otherwise that food should go to me! Cause I'm just sooo BIG!"

Machoke rammed his belly right into Riolu, knocking him onto his back. Watching Riolu scramble to get back on his feet made Machoke let out a hearty laugh.

"A puny runt like you doesn't deserve food like me!" continued Machoke. "Only pokemon as big..." he patted his giant stomach "...as I am deserves to eat!"

Machoke continued to mock Riolu for his smaller size, while still quite stupid, his comments infuriated Riolu to no end.

"THAT DOES IT!" shouted Riolu, scaring a flock of Taillow in the distance.

Without another word, Riolu ate a bite of the peculiar apple.

"You're gonna eat your scary apple?" teased Machoke. "Ohhh! I'm so scared!"

While Machoke continued to laugh at the seemingly pathetic action, he failed to notice the pink glow beginning to shine from Riolu's eyes.

"Oh no!" Machoke said in a fake-scared voice. "The tiny, itsy-bitsy bug is going to eat a freaky-lookin' apple. Whatever shall I do? Whuh? Hey! Put me down!"

Since he was too busy teasing to notice, Riolu had lifted Machoke in an unusual display of strength.

"Put me down before somebody sees!" demanded Machoke. "If anyone sees me being lifted by a whelp like you...!"

But before Machoke could say anything else, Riolu opened his mouth as wide as he could, and in one big *GLUP*...the Machoke was gone!

"Ohhhh.......!" moaned Riolu, toppling over onto his back and letting out a loud belch.

His once thin body was now stretched to its bursting point, trying to contain the amount of mass it just ingested.

"Oww..." whispered Riolu, rubbing what he could of his dangerously bloated mid-section. "...my tummy hurts!"

When he ate a bite of that apple, Riolu felt like he could eat everything. But the effects must have worn-off, leaving the poor pokemon with a giant tummy ache.

He glanced back at the bitten apple, sitting a few inches away from him. Maybe eating some more of it would help ease the pain?

But despite it being so close, Riolu hardly felt like moving at all with his over-flowing belly.
122.title: If you can't beat 'em...EAT 'em!

13.content:
Title: He came to a small waterfall.

...He came to a small waterfall.

The sound of babbling water woke Riolu from his poor, lack of food induced trance, and found himself at the local waterfall.

The waterfall was a beautiful place. All the Pokémon from the forest came here one way or another to get a drink of water or bathe or just play around in. Riolu had always meant to come here, but he couldn't truly appreciate its beauty when he was starving. Instead of taking in the sights, the cute little thing looked around for anything to eat.

Nope. Just water.

Riolu moaned out of frustration and pain. "I just wanna eat. Is that too much to ask!" He said to no one in particular. Riolu went to the water and sat down on the sand.

"Why do I have to be so small" Riolu started to cry. "I train myself every day so I can get stronger and evolve, but no matter what I do, I'm still the cute and small Pokémon every one takes pity on!" Now Riolu really was crying. He broke out into a waterworks of tears and was only compounded by the empty feeling in his stomach.

However, Riolu's blubbering suddenly halted as he smelt something in between his sniffles. " 'Hic' it smells like...smells like..." He opened his eyes wide.

"FOOD!" Riolu shouted with upmost glee. He instantly got up and ran to the source of the smell. It smelled so good, it was like nothing he ever experienced before. This was the first time that he ever got so happy about eating, but after that incident with that bully Machoak, he needed to prove he wasn't the weakling everyone thought of him. L

Eventually, Riolu came to the source of the smell. It was a...
Option #1: ...A Trainef Campsite
Option #2: ...A Snorlax Feasting Away
Option #3: ...A Human House
Option #4: ...An Abandoned Truck full of food
Option #5: Reader's Choice
13.title: He came to a small waterfall.

choices: He bumps into a box of Rare Candies
A week later of the Old Lady’s cooking
133.content:
He ran towards the smell which grew stronger and stronger. He eventually got to a small wooden building. Riolu looked at its window and see a scrumptious pie on the bench near it. Lucky to his super light weight, he can jump and climb over the window to grab the pie.

“Hey there little guy.” Riolu said to the pie that was making him almost drool in hunger. “Listen here, I want to have something in my stomach to survive so I need you in it. Say something and I won’t eat you.” There was no response other then a loud grumble from his abdomen. “Guess your mine!” He shouted in his head as he ate the pie with incredible speed.

“Soo good.” He thought as the pie was quickly being replaced by nothing. Once he finished, he looked st his stomach to see a decent bump on it. He then heard an old lady speaking so softly.

“Oh, and what is this, a little hungry Riolu?” Riolu turned in fear and placed his paws over his mouth to cover the crumbs. “It’s alright dearly. I don’t have anyone else to give it to, you can have another if you want.” He didn’t understand what she meant until a smelled another pie, just as good.

Knowing the woman wouldn’t understand him if he talked, he uncovered his face and nodded. “Okay then, give me a sec.” the lady went back inside and went to the window to pass him another pie. Riolu then swallowed a few bites slower then before until he finished. His stomach was poking out a little more again as he did a baby burp.

“Sounds like you enjoyed that, didn’t you sweetie?” The Riolu nodded again. “I’m glad you do; I’m sorry but I gotta go to sell the rest nearby, I’ll see you tomorrow.” She walked off as Riolu waved and headed to the other direction. This was going to be interesting. “How lucky was I?” Questioned Riolu.
133.title: A Human Feast

134.content:
After a short hike, Riolu reached a truck. There was none around and Riolu looked inside the truck. He remebered a man, whose shirt had the same logo as the truck, running away from the forest. Riolu decided this was that man's truck. Riolu opened the truck and found some human food. He thought 'Well, technically the man ran away, so it is not theft' and dug in. He started by eating some donuts, then began munching on hot dogs. His thin frame was getting filled as his stomached rounded. Riolu haven't eaten for a long time and enjoyed stuffing himself. After he ate, he fell in food coma.
         When Riolu woke up, it was already night. He stood up, feeling different. He saw a puddle close to the truck and went to it. When Riolu looked at it he saw that all the food was digested but not without a mark - he had a small belly. 'If I keep eating like this, I will get bigger than Machoke. And I like stuffing myself... I will show that moron who is stronger!' said Riolu. Just then his belly rumbled again. 'Better get some food' he said. Riolu went back to the truck. He began eating. When Riolu felt full, he continued eating, begin impatient to outweight Machoke. After stuffing himself to the brim, Riolu began sleeping.
134.title: The abandoed food.

1342.content:
The following days turned into a full week's worth of non-stop eating, sleeping, and fantasizing. It seemed that with each passing meal, Riolu grew just a little wider, a little rounder, a little softer. By the end of the week, his stomach had effectively doubled, maybe even tripled, in size. His thighs were beginning to swell outwards, ballooning with fat. Bit by bit, Riolu was growing, and he couldn't be happier. Well, except for one thing. Maybe two.

Sometimes, whenever Riolu felt especially lonely, he would hug his tail, similarly to how human children would hug their blankets or toys. But with his added girth, Riolu began to notice that it was becoming harder just to grab the darn thing to begin with. Not too much harder, but enough for him to see a difference. And just an hour ago, he tried testing his new size by lifting nearby rocks and punching the truck in hopes of making a dent. Moderately sized stones that originally weren't too much of a hassle to throw were now nearly impossible to lift off the ground. Punching the sides of the truck had little effect, even when putting all of his might into it, which only succeeded in hurting his arm. It was as if his muscles were disappearing, rather than growing. Brushing his worries aside, Riolu continued eating the block of cheese he had opened. Maybe he just needs to eat a little more. Suddenly, Riolu's ears perked up, detecting noise nearby. Nervously, he walked towards the source of the strange noise, but before he could exit the truck, Riolu found himself face to face with.....
1342.title: After a week of stuffing

info.brief_description: Riolu wants to be the biggest and heaviest pokemon EVER!
info.description:
This is a story about a young, underweight Riolu who is constantly mocked because he is so small. Tried of being called "tiny" and "light-weight", Riolu tries to become the world's heaviest pokemon by eating as much as he can.
